name: Harper Lee
bio: American novelist best known for her 1960 novel To Kill a Mockingbird.

name: George Orwell
bio: English novelist, essayist, journalist and critic, famous for Animal Farm and 1984.

name: J.K. Rowling
bio: British author and philanthropist, best known for writing the Harry Potter fantasy series.

name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
bio: American novelist, essayist, and short story writer, best known for The Great Gatsby.

name: Jane Austen
bio: English novelist known primarily for her six major novels, which interpret, critique and comment upon the British landed gentry.

name: J.D. Salinger
bio: American writer best known for his novel The Catcher in the Rye.

name: J.R.R. Tolkien
bio: English writer, poet, philologist, and academic, best known as the author of the high fantasy works The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings.

name: Ray Bradbury
bio: American author and screenwriter, famous for Fahrenheit 451.

name: Charlotte Brontë
bio: English novelist and poet, the eldest of the three Brontë sisters, best known for Jane Eyre.

name: Herman Melville
bio: American novelist, short story writer, and poet of the American Renaissance period, best known for Moby-Dick.

name: Paulo Coelho
bio: Brazilian lyricist and novelist, best known for his novel The Alchemist.

name: Fyodor Dostoevsky
bio: Russian novelist, philosopher, short story writer, essayist, and journalist.

name: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
bio: French writer, poet, aristocrat, journalist and pioneering aviator.

name: Aldous Huxley
bio: English writer and philosopher, best known for his dystopian novel Brave New World.

name: Gabriel García Márquez
bio: Colombian novelist, short-story writer, screenwriter, and journalist.

name: Dan Brown
bio: American author best known for his thriller novels, including the Robert Langdon stories.

name: Khaled Hosseini
bio: Afghan-American novelist, physician, and activist, known for The Kite Runner.

name: Mary Shelley
bio: English novelist who wrote the Gothic novel Frankenstein.
